result.execSummary:
The defendant James A Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intimidate Witness [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.42.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court waived all nonmandatory court costs, fees and surcharges, but imposed all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges including DV & DNA surcharges, to be paid from 25% of prison funds, to be collected by DOC,   due during term of Initial Confinement. Balance on Extended supervision on case 13CF4501. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Good time credit.  To be served at Wisconsin State Prison with sentence on case 13CF4501.
Court advised due to DV conviction under Federal Law the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession.

the motion to dismiss these appeals is granted. It is further ordered that the motion requesting that this court make copies of Smith's submission of August 10, 2015 is denied as moot. 2014AP1877CR, 2014AP1878CR & 2014AP1879CR. tf

records.addlTxt: per order dated December 2, 2015, Appeal 2014AP1877CR (13CF2453), 2014AP1878CR (13CF4501), 2014AP1879CR (14CF1664), the petition for review is denied, without costs.

Supreme Court Petition for Review has been filed on Appeal 2014AP001877CR, 2014AP001878CR, and 2014AP001879CR by Defendant James A. Smith Jr. 
per notice dated October 1, 2015.
per order dated September 10, 2015, Appeal 2014AP1877, 14AP1878CR, and 14AP1829CR, the motion to reconsider, as construed, is denied.

per order September 10, 2015, Appeal 2014AP1877CR (13CF2453), 2014AP1878 (13CF4501), 2014AP1879CR (14CF1664), the motion to dismiss these appeal is granted. The motion requesting that this court make copies of Smith's submission fo August 10, 2015, is denied as moot.

Supreme Court order dated July 6, 2015, Appeal 2015AP646-W, cases 13CF2453, 13CF4501 and 14CF1664, the motion for reconsideration is granted in part; the petitioner has been deemed indigent. The June 2, 2015 order is vacated and the petition for supervisory writ is reinstated. The petition is deemed a request for reconsideration of this court's previous order denying consolidation and is therefore dismissed.

Original Record transmitted to the Court of Appeals by mail. Last Page No. 25
Appeal No. 2014AP1879CR.
records.descr: Transmittal of record to court of appeals

records.addlTxt: Court of Appeals order dated June 10, 2015, Appeals 2014AP1877CR (13CF2453), 2014AP1878CR (13CF4501) and 2014AP1879CR (14CF1664), Smith's "Petition and Supporting Memorandum Asking Permission to Appeal" is denied. This appeal shall proceed with only those transcripts that have already been filed because Smith has failed to file a statement on transcript. The clerk of the circuit court shall transmit the records to this court no later than twenty days from the date of this order.

Court of Appeals order dated May 19, 2015, Appeals 2014AP1877CR (13CF2453), 2014AP1878CR (13CF4501) and 2014AP1879CR (14CF1664), the motion for reconsideration of the December 12, 2014 order is denied. The deadline to file a statement on transcripts is extended to June 9, 2015. Failure to file a proper statement or appropriate extension motion will result in these appeals proceeding without the filing of any outstanding transcripts.

Court of Appeals order dated March 5, 2015, Appeals 2014AP1877CR (13CF2453), 2014AP1878CR (13CF4501) and 2014AP1879CR (14CF1664), the deadline to file the statement on transcript (or statements if applicable) or move for an extension is extended to March 26, 2015.

Supreme Court order dated February 10, 2015, Appeal 2014AP1929-W, cases 13CF2453, 13CF4501 & 14CF1664, the motion for reconsideration of this court's December 30, 2014 order is denied. the petition for review is denied without costs.

Supreme Court order dated February 10, 2015, Appeals 2014AP1877CR (13CF2453), 2014AP1878CR (13CF4501) and 2014AP1879CR (14CF1664), the motion to reconsider the January 6, 2015 order dismissing the petition for review is denied. Any requests/motions for appellate relief should be addressed to the Court of Appeals, where these appeals remain pending.

per order dated January 28, 2015 the motion to waive the requirement to file a conforming statement on transcript is denied.  The deadline for Smith to file a statement on transcript is extended thru 2/18/15. tf

Supreme Court order dated January 6, 2015, Appeals 2014AP1877CR (13CF2453), 2014AP1878CR (13CF4501) and 2014AP1879CR (14CF1664), the petition for review is dismissed. The subject of a petition for review must be the final decision of the Court of Appeals. The Court of Appeals has not yet rendered its final decision.mg

Court of Appeals order dated December 30, 2014, Appeal 2014AP1929-W, cases 13CF2453, 13CF4501 and 14CF1664, the motion for consolidation of the petition for review with the matters pending in the Court of Appeals is denied. The subject of a petition for review must be the final, adverse decision of the Court of Appeals. The Court of Appeals has not yet rendered its final decision so those cases cannot be consolidated with the petition for review that has been filed in 2014AP1929-W in this court.mg

per order dated December 12, 2014 IT IS ORDERED that the hold previously imposed in these matters is lifted. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the notice of appeal filed in these three matters on August 11, 2014, is construed as both a notice of intent to pursue postconviction relief and a notice of appeal. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that, for each of the three circuit court cases (13CF2453,13CF4501,14CF1664) at issue here, the clerk of circuit court shall, within five days after the date of this order, send to Smith at the address on this order the materials described in WIS. STAT. RULE 809.30(2)(c)2. IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that, if Smith wishes to seek retained or appointed counsel, he shall so notify this court by January 14, 2015. 
 IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the deadline for Smith to file a statement on transcript that conforms with the rules of appellate procedure is extended through January 26, 2015. See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.82(2)(a). IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the public defenders report is accepted as filed. 14AP1877CR, 14AP1878CR, 14AP1879CR. tf
Original Transcript (58 pages) commencing SENTENCING HEARING 08/01/2014 received and filed.

Petition for Review by the Supreme Court has been filed on Appeal No. 2014AP1929-W, cases 13CF2453, 13CF4501 and 14CF1664 by the defendant, James A. Smith, Jr.
per notice dated November 14, 2014.mg
Court of Appeals order dated October 22, 2014, Appeal 2014AP1929-W, cases 14CF1664, 13CF4501 and 13CF2453, the petition for writ of habeas corpus is denied ex parte.mg

Court of Appeals order dated November 10, 2014, Appeals 2014AP1877CR (13CF2453), 2014AP1878CR (13CF4501) and 2014AP1879CR (14CF1664), these appeals are stayed pending further order of this court. This matter is referred to the Office of the State Public Defender to determine whether Smith is eligible for appointed appellate counsel. The State Public Defender shall submit a status report within thirty days indicating whether counsel will be appointed. The motion to consolidate this appeal with Smith's petition for writ of habeas corpus, Appeal 2014AP1929-W is denied. These three appeals are consolidated. The Statement on Transcript submitted by Smith is rejected. The deadline to file a Statement on Transcript is stayed until further order of this court. The motion entitled "781.01 Extra Ordinary Remedy as Provisional Remedy" is denied. The appellant's brief submitted by Smith is rejected. Smith's motion for waiver of the requirement that his brief contain all of the content required by Wis. Stat. Rule 809.19 is denied. Smith's motion that we waive certain briefing requirements is denied.mg

filed.mg

Defendant James Smith in court, in custody, Defendant appears PRO SE.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant, and victim. 

AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to a 7 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive, with GOOD TIME credit, to be served at the Wisconsin State Prison with sentence on case 13CF4501. The court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges, but imposed all Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges including DV & DNA surcharges due during term of initial confinement and then on extended supervision  on case 13CF4501 in cases to paid from 25% of prison funds, and to be collected on extended supervision by DOC, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to DV conviction under federal law the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession.
Filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief,  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Received & Filed, Letter to the court.
Received & Filed, Defendant's Pro Se Motion: Chapter 781 Extraordinary Remedy For Injuctive Relief.
Received & Filed, Pro se Motion: Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus.
Received & Filed, Letter to the Court.

AS TO COUNT 1 AS AMENDED
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence. Court held colloquy with defendant as to Pre-Sentence Investigation, state and defense do not request a P.S.I. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Sentencing.

Defendant James Smith in court with attorney Jacqueline Rogers as STANDBY Counsel.  Defendant James Smith in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Stand By counsel advised court that defendant has filed an OLAR complaint against her, and motioned the court to withdraw as standby counsel. Court held colloquy with defendant. Court GRANTED Attorney Rogers request. Defendant will proceed Pro Se, without Standby counsel.  Court discussed defendant's most recent motion filed with the court. Court holds colloquy with defendant as to plea negotiations. Defendant wishes to enter in to a plea agreement with the state. 
AS TO COUNT 1
On a motion of the state pursuant to plea negotiations, the court ordered Counts 1 amended to Intimidate Witness Misdemeanor, Domestic Abuse, contrary to Wis Stat. 940.42, 968.075(1)(a), a class A Misdemeanor.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Received & Filed, Defendant's Extraordinary Remedy as Provisional Remedy.
Court set matter for Status Conference in branch 23, Stand By Counsel, MCSD, ADA notified.

Appeals 2014AP935CR (14CF1664), 2014AP1051CR (13CF2453) and 2014AP1052CR (13CF4501) for lack of jurisdiction. Any other outstanding motions in these matters are denied as moot, per opinion and order dated June 5, 2014.mg

records.addlTxt: Defendant James Smith in court with attorney Jacqueline Rogers as Stand By Counsel.  Defendant James Smith in custody.  Nicolas Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appeared PRO SE. Discussion as to defendant's pending interlock appeal. Court found it can not proceed with jury trial, pending resolution of defendant's appeal. Case is suspending pending resolution. State's offer for resolution of this matter is denied, and revoked. Defendant's motion to unseal pro se letters to the court, GRANTED. Court held colloquy with the defendant. Defendant advised he will need to file a brief as to his most recent motion filing. Case is adjourned for a Status Conference in branch 23.  Status conference scheduled for July 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Received & Filed (per court ordere sealed), letter Pro Se motion, letter.
Received & Filed, (per court orderd sealed), Pro Se Notice of Appeal.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee County D.A. Investigator Carl Buschmann.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense objection to bind over denied, defendant's motion to dismiss, denied.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Court Joined cases 14CF1664, 13CF2453 & 13CF4501. Case set for Jury trial with pending matters in branch 23 on 5/27/2014 at 8:30 am.

Per Court's De Novo ruling, initial appearance proceeded.  
Defendant in receipt of a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing. The court read the initial appearance into the record.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.

Defendant James A Smith in court, IN CUSTODY. Attorney Jacqueline Rogers appeared in court, not appointed on this matter.  Nicolas Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion regarding defendant's pending matters. SPD office did not appoint Attorney Rogers on this matter, defendant wishes to proceed pro se. Further discussion regarding joinder, scheduling, and appointment of counsel.

Defendant made an Oral De Novo Motion as to Commissioner David Sweet presiding over the Initial Appearance of 4/22/2014 in In Custody Intake Court. The court GRANTED defendant's motion, and VACATED the initial appearance proceeding of 4/22/2014, court will hold initial appearance today. 

Defendant, James A Smith sworn in. Court held colloquy with defendant regarding his right to proceed pro se.   The court found the defendant freely, knowingly, and willingly is WAIVING his right to counsel. Court will allow defendant to proceed Pro Se. Court appointed Attorney Rogers as STAND BY COUNSEL. Defense objection to stand by counsel, denied by the court.
Received & Filed, State's Motion To Admit Cheryl Smith's Statements Under Forfeiture By Wrongdoing.

Attorney Jacqueline Rogers in court, defendant James A Smith not in court, in custody.  Matthew G Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT produced. Case set for Status. Case set for Preliminary Hearing on 5/2/2014. Court will address joinder on that date. Case adjourned for Preliminary Hearing and Status Conference in branch 23.  Status conference scheduled for May 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant James A Smith in court with attorney Alexis R Liggins.  Defendant James A Smith in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Court preserves Defendant's right to challenge complaint, bail and jurisdiction before the trial court.  DEFENDANT WISHES TO PROCEED PRO SE.
